Tied to how editors that do not persist are managed.
Found this when working with editors in an RCP application.

If you create multiple editor panes and they are occupied by editors that do not persist, when you restart the workbench both (or more) panes are empty and visible.
>If there are no editors to be displayed, should the UI not return to one empty editor pane?

In 3.1.1, if you open an editor it uses one of the multiple panes; when closed that pane disappears.  Same for 3.2M4.
In both 3.1.1 and 3.2M4, if you drag one of the panes you can create additional panes, all empty.  To close these extra panes you have to open an editor in each one and then close the editor.

When you close the workbench with multiple empty editor panes in 3.2M4 there is no problem, but in 3.1.1 you get an exception:  Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.ui.workbench".
Partial stack trace:

When workbench is restarted you continue to see multiple editor panes.

> 3.2M4 is ok here, but 3.1.1 should attempt to catch or prevent the exception.

To demo/test this you do not need any code.

1) start a test instance of the workbench SDK
2) create a plug-in project with the hello world example
3) on the extensions page of the editor, use the "show description" popup menu for an extension element
4) use the Window > New editor action to create two editors with extension description content
5) close the plugin.xml editor
6) arrange the two description editors in two editor panes
7) close workbench

On 3.1.1 you will see an error dialog, details in the .log.
No error on 3.2M4, but the multiple editor pane on restart is there as it is in 3.1.1.

Real issue is not IDE so much as that class of user can probably ignore and will not often have editors that do not persist. It is RCP applications and those users that may have trouble with both the exception at close and the return to a UI with multiple empty editor panes (nonpersistent RCP Editors may be more common).

That and the thought that maybe multiple editor panes should not be shown when they are empty (close any extra empty editor panes).

Think I left out workbench start/stop (8/9):

1) start a test instance of the workbench SDK
2) create a plug-in project with the hello world example
3) on the extensions page of the editor, use the "show description" popup menu
for an extension element
4) use the Window > New editor action to create two editors with extension
description content
5) close the plugin.xml editor
6) arrange the two description editors in two editor panes
7) close workbench
8) Restart workbench (now you see two empty editor panes)
9) Close Workbench - this is when the exeception is thrown on 3.1.1

Is this still a problem in 3.3?
